byline.contributor: Maher Samaan contributed reporting from Beirut, Lebanon.

abstract: Deal between supporters and opponents of Bashar al-Assad negotiated by Iran and Sunni Islamist group Ahrar al-Sham calls for six-month ceasefire so that control over territories in two different parts of country can be traded; far-reaching deal, which will involve sectarian population exchange, will not involve Islamic State.
lead_paragraph: Supporters and opponents of President Bashar al-Assad will trade territory in two parts of the country and pledge to observe a six-month cease-fire.

headline.main: Truce Struck in 2 Areas of Syria
headline.print_headline: Territory Trade Is Part of Cease-Fire Deal in 2 Areas of Syria

snippet: Supporters and opponents of President Bashar al-Assad will trade territory in two parts of the country and pledge to observe a six-month cease-fire.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
